oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Envelope addressed to Capt. A. R. Gordon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Addressed to Capt. A. R. Gordon, P. War, Johnson's Island, Sandusky City, Ohio. Marked "Re'd May the 12th 1865." Written across bottom is "Block 4, Mess 2, Room 22." This envelope may belong with a letter Gen. G. W. Gordon wrote to his cousin Andrew. (See tsla053) Capt. Gordon was a member of Co. E, 11th Holman's Tennessee Cav. Regt., CSA, and was captured in 1864. A Giles County farmer, he owned eight slaves in 1860. He married Rebecca Dickerson.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
